title: Naga
data:
The **naga** is a [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, and is represented by the uppercase [N](/wiki/N "N") glyph (N). Nagas are designated internally by the macro `S_NAGA`.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

The monster class contains the following monsters:[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

- N [red naga hatchling](/wiki/Red_naga_hatchling "Red naga hatchling")
- N [black naga hatchling](/wiki/Black_naga_hatchling "Black naga hatchling")
- N [golden naga hatchling](/wiki/Golden_naga_hatchling "Golden naga hatchling")
- N [guardian naga hatchling](/wiki/Guardian_naga_hatchling "Guardian naga hatchling")
- N [red naga](/wiki/Red_naga "Red naga")
- N [black naga](/wiki/Black_naga "Black naga")
- N [golden naga](/wiki/Golden_naga "Golden naga")
- N [guardian naga](/wiki/Guardian_naga "Guardian naga")

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Common traits](#Common_traits)
  - [1.1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 History](#History)

- [3 Origin](#Origin)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [4.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.3 notdNetHack](#notdNetHack)
  - [4.4 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [6 References](#References)

## Common traits

Nagas are [slithy](/wiki/Slithy "Slithy"), [limbless](/wiki/Limb "Limb") monsters that have the head of a human and the body of a [snake](/wiki/Snake_\(monster_class\)#Body_parts "Snake (monster class)"); their young are referred to as **naga hatchlings**. All nagas are [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong"), [oviparous](/wiki/Oviparous "Oviparous") and [thick-skinned](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned"), and primarily attack via bites - all hatchlings are [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral")-aligned, while all adults have a secondary attack of some kind. Nagas are capable of consuming meat and, with the exception of black nagas, are also [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivorous "Omnivorous"). Nagas have [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"), and [eating](/wiki/Eating "Eating") their [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tins](/wiki/Tin "Tin") may grant the intrinsic.

All naga hatchlings are large, while all adult nagas are huge. Nagas are considered [kebabable](/wiki/Kebabable "Kebabable"), and grant a +2 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") bonus when attacking them with a weapon that uses the [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear") [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill"). Nagas are capable of wearing [helms](/wiki/Helm "Helm") and [amulets](/wiki/Amulet "Amulet"), but cannot put them on due to a lack of limbs.

[Chatting](/wiki/Chatting "Chatting") to a naga or naga hatchling causes them to "mumble incomprehensibly".

### Generation

The naga monster class is the second [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") monster class for [Rogues](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue"), and makes up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the the [Rogue quest](/wiki/Rogue_quest "Rogue quest"); three random nagas are generated on the locate and goal levels within the quest branch at level creation. The nagas will be adults in all cases.

Naga hatchlings do not randomly generate outside of aligned levels or branches such as [Minetown](/wiki/Minetown "Minetown"), [the Oracle level](/wiki/Oracle_\(level\) "Oracle (level)") and [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban"). They can also hatch from corresponding naga eggs, and are sometimes generated as peaceful towards neutral characters.

## History

All nagas are introduced in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Nāga](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/N%C4%81ga "wikipedia:Nāga")***

The Nāga (feminine "Nagi") are a supernatural race of half-human half-serpent beings that can occasionally take human form, and hold cultural significance in the folkloric traditions of many South Asian and Southeast Asian cultures over the past two millennia. Nagas also appear in *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*.

Their most common depiction is that of a snake with a human head, which the default tileset of *NetHack* draws from—other iconographic depictions portray them as human from the waist up and snake from the waist down, wholly human with snakes on the heads and necks, or even as common serpents. Various south and southeastern Asian cultures also portray Nāgas as having multiple usually-serpentine heads.

## Variants

### UnNetHack

[UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") adds two new monsters to the monster class:

- N [white naga](/wiki/White_naga "White naga")
- N [white naga hatchling](/wiki/White_naga_hatchling "White naga hatchling")

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") adds one new monster to the monster class:

- N [ancient naga](/wiki/Ancient_naga "Ancient naga")

Nagas are capable of wearing [snakeleg](/index.php?title=Snakeleg\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Snakeleg (page does not exist)")-shaped armor. [The Wings of Garuda](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/The_Wings_of_Garuda "User:Chris/dNetHack/The Wings of Garuda") is a [ward](/wiki/Ward_\(dNetHack\) "Ward (dNetHack)") that can scare off nagas.

### notdNetHack

In addition to dNetHack details, [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") adds two other new monsters to the monster class:

- N [white naga hatchling](/index.php?title=White_naga_hatchling_\(notdNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "White naga hatchling (notdNetHack) (page does not exist)")
- N [white naga](/index.php?title=White_naga_\(notdNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "White naga (notdNetHack) (page does not exist)")

### SlashTHEM

[SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") adds some new monsters to the monster class, including two from other variants:

- N [blue naga hatchling](/index.php?title=Blue_naga_hatchling\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Blue naga hatchling (page does not exist)")
- N [white naga hatchling](/wiki/White_naga_hatchling "White naga hatchling")
- N [blue naga](/index.php?title=Blue_naga\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Blue naga (page does not exist)")
- N [white naga](/wiki/White_naga "White naga")

## Encyclopedia entry

The naga is a mystical creature with the body of a snake and the head of a man or woman. They will fiercely protect the territory they consider their own. Some nagas can be forced to serve as guardians by a spellcaster of great power.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 54](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/include/monsym.h#L54)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1604](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/monst.c#L1604)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Naga

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The naga is a monster class that appears in NetHack, and is represented by the uppercase N glyph (N). Nagas are designated internally by the macro S_NAGA.[1]

The monster class contains the following monsters:[2]

  • N red naga hatchling
  • N black naga hatchling
  • N golden naga hatchling
  • N guardian naga hatchling
  • N red naga
  • N black naga
  • N golden naga
  • N guardian naga

Contents

  • 1 Common traits
    • 1.1 Generation
  • 2 History
  • 3 Origin
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 UnNetHack
    • 4.2 dNetHack
    • 4.3 notdNetHack
    • 4.4 SlashTHEM
  • 5 Encyclopedia entry
  • 6 References

Common traits

Nagas are slithy, limbless monsters that have the head of a human and the body of a snake; their young are referred to as naga hatchlings. All nagas are strong, oviparous and thick-skinned, and primarily attack via bites - all hatchlings are neutral-aligned, while all adults have a secondary attack of some kind. Nagas are capable of consuming meat and, with the exception of black nagas, are also omnivorous. Nagas have poison resistance, and eating their corpses or tins may grant the intrinsic.

All naga hatchlings are large, while all adult nagas are huge. Nagas are considered kebabable, and grant a +2 to-hit bonus when attacking them with a weapon that uses the spear skill. Nagas are capable of wearing helms and amulets, but cannot put them on due to a lack of limbs.

Chatting to a naga or naga hatchling causes them to "mumble incomprehensibly".

Generation

The naga monster class is the second quest monster class for Rogues, and makes up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the the Rogue quest; three random nagas are generated on the locate and goal levels within the quest branch at level creation. The nagas will be adults in all cases.

Naga hatchlings do not randomly generate outside of aligned levels or branches such as Minetown, the Oracle level and Sokoban. They can also hatch from corresponding naga eggs, and are sometimes generated as peaceful towards neutral characters.

History

All nagas are introduced in NetHack 3.0.0.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Nāga

The Nāga (feminine "Nagi") are a supernatural race of half-human half-serpent beings that can occasionally take human form, and hold cultural significance in the folkloric traditions of many South Asian and Southeast Asian cultures over the past two millennia. Nagas also appear in Dungeons & Dragons.

Their most common depiction is that of a snake with a human head, which the default tileset of NetHack draws from—other iconographic depictions portray them as human from the waist up and snake from the waist down, wholly human with snakes on the heads and necks, or even as common serpents. Various south and southeastern Asian cultures also portray Nāgas as having multiple usually-serpentine heads.

Variants

UnNetHack

UnNetHack adds two new monsters to the monster class:

  • N white naga
  • N white naga hatchling

dNetHack

dNetHack adds one new monster to the monster class:

  • N ancient naga

Nagas are capable of wearing snakeleg-shaped armor. The Wings of Garuda is a ward that can scare off nagas.

notdNetHack

In addition to dNetHack details, notdNetHack adds two other new monsters to the monster class:

  • N white naga hatchling
  • N white naga

SlashTHEM

SlashTHEM adds some new monsters to the monster class, including two from other variants:

  • N blue naga hatchling
  • N white naga hatchling
  • N blue naga
  • N white naga

Encyclopedia entry

The naga is a mystical creature with the body of a snake and the head of a man or woman. They will fiercely protect the territory they consider their own. Some nagas can be forced to serve as guardians by a spellcaster of great power.


References

  1. ↑ include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 54
  2. ↑ src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1604
